subject: RE: [junit] non-assertable test: output to console?
msgSnippet: ... One possible way to test anything written directly to System.out/err is to use System.setOut()/setErr(), capture the output and analyze it. --oleg
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: epahelper [mailto:timmansfield@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2002 9:05 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] non-assertable test: output to console?
>
>
> hello,
>
> just wondering if there's a way to use junit to test whether a Logger
> is spitting out the expected output to console.

One possible way to test anything written directly to System.out/err is to
use System.setOut()/setErr(), capture the output and analyze it.

--oleg
